title: Bundesstraße 186
text:
The Bundesstraße 186 is a German federal highway. Originally, this road ran from <a href="K%C3%B6then">Köthen</a> to <a href="Bitterfeld">Bitterfeld</a>. During East German rule, the number 186 was reassigned to a loop running around the city of <a href="Leipzig">Leipzig</a>. Due to <a href="brown%20coal">brown coal</a> mining, two strips of road in the north (between <a href="Schkeuditz">Schkeuditz</a> and <a href="Taucha">Taucha</a>) and the south (between <a href="Zwenkau">Zwenkau</a> and <a href="Markkleeberg">Markkleeberg</a>) had to be demolished, splitting up the road into two segments.
In 2010, the eastern segment was degraded, leaving only the western segment.
